reviews.review_msg: I took this class in Spring when it was online, hands down one of the best professors. He was a prosecutor so he is very informative and teaches in an organized & clear manner. He is always accessible outside of class and wants students to genuinely learn and understand the content. Highly recommend professor Fehr.

TAKE ANY CLASS YOU CAN WITH HIM!!! he's super helpful and provides a lot of feedback so you can do well in his class. He's a hidden gem at SFU and I honestly wish I could take more classes with him and I suck at criminal law.

He didn't provide any criteria as to how to write the memorandum and only provided a sample answer after the assignment was due. They don't tell you what legal rules or laws to apply into the memorandum scenario, but if you use the wrong one, you won't get a good grade even partial marks.

The course content is obviously challenging; however, it is manageable and Dr. Fehr is very approachable during the lectures and is flexible for office hours. Tips: prepare case briefs before every lec. for the new case law (already cited in his lec. slides & that way you wont cram for the final exam!), start the memos early, & go to office hours

His lecture slides on case law, Criminal Code and Charter provisions were explained well. He indicated which topics would be tested. It was difficult to work on the first memorandum, since he didn't provide a sample, but he produced answers for the first memo that outlined expectations for the second memo. Use his lecture slides for the final exam!

Final exam is open book but requires memorization of 11 week's worth of legal rules/case law. I only finished in time because I studied harder than I ever have. You MUST know the legal rules and cases associated with each set of rules. Pro tip: type all notes in a word doc and "ctrl F" to search doc for answer on exam will save your life, trust me.
We got 3 hours to complete the final and I found it kinda impossible to do because there's 2 parts which was the memo and a "short" essay

Colton is awesome and I Found the memos really fun but stressful. You really got to know all the cases which is quite overwhelming but go to him for help he is great and only way you will do good. Marking depends on the TA and can make or break your grade. Also the final is impossible to do within 3 hrs due to it being cumulative with 2 parts

He likes to ramble and he expects his students to all be lawyers when it comes to the memo assignments. I get this "I'm better than you" feeling from him. I also don't understand why he tells us to purchase the textbook and then say that it is not good and is essentially useless.

Professor Fehr is a great professor and explains things quite clearly. Attending lecture is a must as he gives hints on exams and assignments. The assignments can be tough and require lots of critical thinking but as long as you understand the material it should not be too hard. He's a great professor, highly recommend! But get ready to do work!

Dr. Love (Wheeler) is excellent! I have had 2 classes with her now and found both to be very good. Her grading expectations are clear and she is passionate about the subject matter. She's also very involved in the online course delivery and responds to inquiries quickly. Would highly recommend.
She responds really fast even sometimes at 1 am. The exam was very hard for this course but she met with me to really help with the assignments and final exam

Karm is the first TA to ever reach out when I was struggling. She was TAing two courses and had more than 100 students yet she noticed when I didn't submit an assignment. Without judgement, she contacted me individually to see if I was okay. Karm isn't just a good TA. She's also a good person. I hope one day she becomes a full-time prof.

This course is tough! she does ask her students to participate in the tutorials which is fair. her feedback and assignment outline is super clear. I loved how passionate she was for her students to succeed in the course. she is a tough but fair marker. I received B+ which is low for me but her feedback is been super helpful. Very caring :D

TAKE HER! Real GEM at SFU...I struggled with the course material. However, Karmvir made it very easy. Her emails her a little short but if you attend her office hours, I bet you will be able to understand all the material. She offers extra office hours whenever students can't attend her office hours. very approachable. if you can, do take her.

One of the least helpful TAs Ive ever had. Doesnt provide good feedback or logical reasoning for grades especially when you provide valid proof showing her she was wrong. Has too much of an ego. Highly rude and very disappointed with the experience. Far too entitled for someone whos just a TA.

Vienna is a stellar teaching assistant; she makes every effort possible to help her students and her warm personality is very comforting when you find yourself lost in the material. Further to this, her tutorials are informative and she does a great job of engaging the class without singling anybody out.

Had her for TA a couple times. She is very biased towards students and marks very subjectively. Lacks communication with professor, and doesn't meet anything she says she will do although on the surface seems nice.
Seriously one of the best TAs I have ever had! She is so caring and creates a really welcoming environment in tutorials. The course was challenging but she was always there to help in when needed.

I have taken Crim 230 and 330 with Maike as my TA. Although these courses are tough, she is really helpful in giving feedback and is always available to assist one on one. She is really understanding and always tries to help out when needed. You feel like she really wants everyone to succeed. Although she is a tougher marker she is always fair.

Amy is an amazing professor! Her lectures are engaging and filled with opportunities to participate. 330 is very content heavy, so keep up with the readings. She offers a bonus opportunity and allows cheat sheets for both exams. Amy makes it clear what she is looking for on assignments, but definitely makes you work hard for your mark.

This was by far one of the worst profs I have ever had
Her test & midterm were reasonable but her case law memo assignment was horrible
she is not specific enough with what she is looking for
I went to her office hours and she told me the class was not for me by just assuming
I did good on the midterm but not the assignment which affected my grade

girl this class crazy, literally not taking the legal studies certificate bc she teaches all those classes for it. get out of the class while u cam, she'll mark ur answer wrong even if its right bUT it doesn't fit her "thought process" ok girl jesus christ of nazareth sheesh

After taking two classes with Amy, I can say that she is very clear with her grading expectations and creates fair exams. In CRIM 330 she offered multiple opportunities for bonus marks after big assignments. If you put in effort, you will be able to do well in her classes, no need to avoid her.

The most boring CRIM class you can ever take at SFU. I don't blame Amy entirely, I feel like anyone who has to teach this course would struggle communicating such dry information to students. However, the textbook she chose to assign is probably the worst written textbook I have ever been forced to read. The TA marks extremely hard.

You either love her or hate her, although I don'y really understand the criticism. She is incredibly clear in her instructions and the course flows in a very organized way. By far the best prof I've had at SFU and she offers very easy bonus opportunities!

This is my first review of a prof in my undergrad degree thus far and I loved how Dr. Conroy and the accompanying TAs delivered this course. Like previous reviews state: pay attention and take notes in lecture. Exams were straightforward and fair, the content was interesting, bonus mark opportunities were plentiful. Overall, super enjoyable course!

Dr. Conroy was an amazing prof. If you attend the lectures and pay attention it is not hard to do well in this class. She also offers many opportunities for bonus marks. For example, if you correct what you got wrong she added 3 extra marks to our midterm marks.

I do not get why everyone hates her so much. I've had her for 4 classes now and every single one was been good. She doesn't put a lot of info in her slides so it means you actually have to pay attention and take notes in her class but like, it university, this is what lectures should be like, anyways just my opinion

DO NOT TAKE HER. SHE IS EXTREMELY UNHELPFUL AND RUDE. SHE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT HER STUDENTS. LECTURE MATERIAL IS NOT ORGANIZED. SLIDES ARE UNHELPFUL. TALKS REALLY FAST THAT YOU CANNOT EVEN TAKE NOTES, NOMATTER HOW FAST OF A TYPER YOU ARE

330 is tough, make no mistake! Although the midterm was definitely tricky, Carol provided opportunities to do well on small assignments. She was also generous and added bonus Q's to the final exam to help boost our grades! Put in the work and focus on her lecture notes, it'll pay off.

Carol is an amazing prof. Law courses are always very difficult but explained concepts very well and made lectures interesting. Test heavy as expected, but adds assignments to help boost our marks after the midterm average of just over 50%
Tests are tough, make sure you tab your code. Great lecturer, she really knows how to present detailed information in a comprehensible way. Textbook is helpful but you can get by without it.

NO way you can breeze through this class. She is VERY knowledgable and inspirational!! Lecture notes are very detailed, and yes they are long but it is essential. Do you really rather take your own notes? Wish this class wasn't at 830am though.. I can barely comprehend at that time. If you need help, go get it, exams can be tricky.
Amazing and informative lectures - tough grader, but more than fair.  If you put in the effort you will be successful.

Carol and her TA were very kind and easily available for help. However, I found that the exams were a little unfair. Her lecture notes are extremely long; it is open book with the Criminal Code... The supplemental text book was honestly useless.I think you really must learn how to APPLY the criminal code correctly. Similar to a law class

Exams/Participation/1 Assignment Exams are tough, but all the material is available in her lecture slides (posted online). It's dense, but open book with the criminal code.  Not a lot of info on the assignments, but enough in the lecture notes to understand whats being asked..   Class average 73%.  Passionate teacher. Don't buy textbook.
Lecture slides are in the form of essay looking word documents that are OVER 60 pages long. Hard to keep up.

CRIM 330 is a very easy class. Similar to CRIM 230 you are allowed to bring your criminal code to exams. DONT OVER TAB/HIGHLIGHT. I see everyone coming to the exams with literally EVERY page tabbed and pages with PARAGRAPHS highlighted. Her exams look for specific words, it wont help when you're confused with your own aid. ps. dont buy the textbook
She is awesome. Don't really need to buy book, she makes all her notes available. It is a hard course though.

Carol is fantastic! Basically a law school class, so why not take it with an incredibly poised and elite crown prosecutor? I was fortunate enough to have a very small (J) section!! Her first hand experience in the field means navigating the tricky concepts comes easy with her - shes COOL!!! puts on tunes every day before class to chill everyone out

Carol definitely cares about her students, and gives you ample opportunity to do well. She even provided us with exam prep questions for the midterm and final. This is definitely not a class you can just breeze by through, however, the exams were fair and nothing to be taken by surprise. The presentations help boost your grade up

Carol seems to have good intentions but those are lost in the unrealistic expectations for the class. In a 230 person lecture she would make us pass around an attendance sheet every week that was very disrupting. Exams do not reflect material covered in class and the TA assistants were all over the place.
He was extremely helpful and makes you think critically. He chooses to challenge you in class so that you can do better in the course. He will truly be missed now that he has left :(

Kouri is one of the BEST TAs at SFU. He is extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and approachable. He helps you understand very complex legal issues and genuinely cares about his students. However, this is university and he's not going to spoon feed you the answers (you need to do your own work) hes a tremendous asset to haveSFU needs more TAs like him
Fantastic TA, so helpful and knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile to help students. This is the guy to have for Crim 330!
Lack of communication with TA's , non-transparent, does not provide final exam grades or tutorial grades and does not reply back to emails.

Super tough grader! You definitely have to work hard in his class, you'll most likely do terrible on the midterm but then he gives you a lecture after the midterm that scares you to death but makes you do well on the final! Overall, very strict prof and hard class. But you will learn so much from Bowbrick! Incredible prof! Very knowledgeable!

Everything is based on his lectures. You need to get lecture recordings and write down everything he says in the lecture. Then you will be fine. The exam is open book and it is not hard if you study what he said. Our class average was okay. Just remember to write down everything he says! You can get easy B then.

well what can I say? This class is a requirement for your degree so you have no choice but to take it. Be aware of his expectation , it is unreal. Definitely kill your GPA if you do not write or think as a lawyer.

Provides clear lecture notes, and is a great lecturer. Does not use a textbook, so class is 100% lecture. He has by far the hardest exams, and don't fall into the trap of not studying despite it being open book. I can't recommend seeing your TA about how to write the exam problems enough. It'll probably jump your grade 20% Incredibly inspirational

Graeme Bowbrick is a tough but fair marker. HOWEVER if there is a situation where you need help due to circumstances out of your control, do NOT expect him to help. He basically says it's your own fault for missing things and even if you take responsibility for whatever you missed, (not giving excuses or asking for pity) he will NOT help you.

One of the best profs I have had. He is a hard marker and has high expectations however is very thorough with what he expects and gives very helpful lecture notes. I would not recommend having a tutorial with him as he doesn't help very much with the problems but would definitely recommend taking any class with him.

The absolute BEST. If you have the chance to take him, please do. He literally changed my whole perspectives. He is tough but that's because he pushes his students to be the best they can be. and honestly, if you do as he says, you'll do great. I would love to take another course with him

Amazing lectures - you'd be lucky to have Graeme as your prof for this course. His exams are definitely tough in the sense that half the class didn't even finish their exams and the class average was really low. It's an open-book exam, but you don't have too much time to spend on MC questions. You want to focus on the written part. Trust me.

Graeme is incredibly thorough in his explanation of the material for this course.  I highly advise going to class with the lecture slides already printed out, and taking notes as you go.  I have no criticisms of this professor, he is truly outstanding.

Went in this class thinking it was going to be super hard, but the lectures and tutorial were both interesting and engaging. I barely read the texrtbook, was familiar with it as I ended up using it for the final for a few questions. Lectures are important, best to have lecture slides printed out and you write notes in as you attend lectures. I

Learned a lot in Graeme's class! He prepares you well for the MT and Final--just read the slides he makes and you're pretty much golden. Didn't need to read the textbook, and the paper was easy marks.

Graeme is an awesome teacher. His lectures are relevant and interesting, he has a sense of humor and in smaller classes he really gets everyone talking. His power points are super detailed, and you always know what he's looking for when grading. Plus, his intelligence and strong views make him hot. Enjoy! I've had at least 4 classes with him.

Might be 'easy' for his lower division but has really high expectations for his 330 class. Like said below, definitely a GPA dropper, highest make on the  midterm was a B+. You of course learn a lot and he is engaged in the material but the way he marks is just ridiculous. Avoid if possible.

He is a horrible prof. His exams are brutual even though they are opened book. I made great notes in class and everything. Organized my notes. WAs able to find answers but it just isnt good enough for him. He marks extremely hard. And plus u do not get enough time. I would not recommend him. Not a gpa booster at all!!!!

Look, this class isn't meant to be easy but Graeme is a wonderful professor. He's very intelligent and clearly knows what he is talking about. He WANTS his students to do well. Open book exams, and minimal textbook use I would recommend him for any serious students. Would definitely take again.
she is the most amazing prof! wow. don't take this one for granted

She's nice and allowed extensions when life stuff happened to me. But the TAs marked extremely hard, and their comments were kind of mean. I read the whole textbook and spent an entire week writing the midterm, but I only got about 70%. Sadly, it was like this for every assignment.

The class was very straightforward, especially if you did well in 200 level Crim law classes.  Keep up with readings, do the supplementary work if you don't understand and reach out if you need help. Clear expectations and everything on the exams were reflected in the course content. 
Word limit requires you to streamline and refine ideas.

Not gonna lie, I could have put a little more effort. BUT, the fact that this course was online made it harder for me. Lots of readings, the TAs were tough graders, and the final exams were so hard to complete because of the word limit (2000 words). The textbook was 100$ and it was sooooo long and hard to read. The prof was nice tho.

This class was brutal. TA's marked super hard and lectures were very vague considering the depth of the content we need to know. The exam papers were difficult to complete unless you have a good understanding of the law and legal rules which is difficult if you don't know much about the law. The textbook was also difficult to follow and understand.

Required you purchase her own $100 online only textbook. Couldn't write about/include any cases not from her textbook and would get severely docked if did so. Ta's mark particularly hard and the comments are quite petty. 4+ assignments plus midterm and final, class was interesting but overall a lot of work.

great teacher for engaging students into the content, but this class is graded tough af. They want everything picture perfect. If u are a crim major and need to take this class, thats fine, but try to find a friend who has taken it with Dr. Love before or smthn otherwise u will be pulling hairs out reading the TAs grading comments too

This class is tough. The professor is great though and the content is interesting, but you really need to put in the work if you want to do well in this class. Lectures are helpful if you don't understand the textbook. Word limits are hard to follow though because there's so much case law to fit in... but I guess its a skill you need to learn.

I've previously had a course with Dr Love and think shes a nice and accommodating prof, however the online version of this course has little to no lectures and is mostly reading a textbook to understand the material. The papers are fair to the material but lack of lectures does make it harder to understand core important concepts

Dr. Love is one of the best profs in the Crim dept. I took 330 with her and I bet nobody can teach better than her, you can see her passion for law in the lecture. She is accessible outside of class and is genuinely concerned about giving her best feedback for us to improve though, exams have very short-word limits. HIGHLY HIGHLY recommended!!!

Definitely a nice and caring prof who has pretty engaging lectures. Her assignments and exams are very lengthy. She is a pretty hard marker and gave too short of a word limit for everything. The exams are really just one large essay/assignment. However, if you pay attention and take notes from lectures, you'll do well.

Dr. Love was very clear and engaging. She made sure you had the tools to do very well on her assignments; if you paid attention it was obvious what things you should expect on exams. There were also several guest lectures which was exciting. If you had her for CRIM 230, her assignment and exams are quite similar but I actually found it easier.

Her lecturers are good and she tries to make it entertaining for students and keep engagement. The only problem with this class is the assignments are graded way too harshly. They give you a word count and expect you to apply all the rules and applicable laws to it within the word count. It is impossible to touch on everything and stay within it.

Makes you buy her own textbook filled with grammatical errors. Lectures don't detail textbook material, leaving you confused about specific cases and rules she wants in assignments. Gives you the tiniest word count but expects you to write everything on the topic; almost everyone went over the word count and were penalized.

I thought I was going to have to put in a lot of work for this class, but with Dr. Love's lectures and supplementary readings, it was easy to read along the e-textbook. She is very approachable and so is her TA, Taylor, where they will help you on approaching and writing the memos. This class gave me the confidence in pursuing law, so thank you!

Took two classes with her and I have no regrets! She is amazing and caring and her lectures are super resourceful! Crim 230 and 330 are meant to be difficult so put in that work! Her TAs are very resourceful and try their best to help you succeed. Her exams are fair but most ppl felt that they are under tight time constraint.

Dr. Love's lectures were great; she used a case study approach and group class activities. Midterm and final were good & online, but you had to give yourself enough time between MC questions and short answers to focus on the LAQ which is the longest portion. Many options for memo assignments. Responsive and caring when you have health/emergencies.

This was my second time taking Helene as a professor. Though she is a great professor and lecturer, many of the same things apply from when I took her class previously. For starters, her exams are very difficult-- unusually so. I feel as if she purposely tries to trick the student with overly difficult questions. Otherwise, she is a good prof.

Helene Love is the best prof for this class. She is clear and organizes her lectures in a great way to ensure that you understand. Flowcharts will be your best friend and don't be afraid to reach out on confusing topics because she replies promptly. The exams are not too bad but definitely require the work, make sure to form relevant flowcharts.

As a fourth year student, I found this course quite difficult, resulting in me getting a lower grade than I have in years. It felt like marks were excessively taken off by the TA's for no reason. For instance, on one of my assignments I got a bunch of marks taken off yet the feedback was nothing but positive with no indication of what I did wrong.

Distance Ed. course didn't see or speak with prof once but the delivery of the course sucked. Read chapter from book, read through module on canvas. 2 exams and then online sessions where u present a question and respond to your own?? Grading for these was super unclear n nobody was sure what to do.

She is kind, good at explaining concepts & provides clear instructions. But, her exams were very tough. Questions in quizzes & exams tend to be very wordy and confusing. Short exam time but require lots of writing for written portions, many students couldn't finish the midterm & final. Things are graded with strict expectations, pay attention!

She is a really nice prof and very knowledgeable, but this course was so difficult. Her exams and assignments are graded VERY toughly. Assignments were worth only 10% each but required the amount of time and effort as a 40% assignment should, which I find very unfair. She has very high expectations of the way she wants things answered.
